books.title: The Story of My Experiments with Truth
books.author: Mahatma Gandhi
books.summary: Gandhi relates his life experiences from his birth in Gujarat in 1869 through the Indian National Congress of 1915.

books.title: The Mucker
books.author: Edgar Rice Burroughs
books.summary: A street tough undergoes a transformation as he navigates the dangerous worlds of Chicago’s slums, a South Pacific island, and the wilds of Mexico.

books.title: The Autobiography of Calvin Coolidge
books.author: Calvin Coolidge
books.summary: The thirtieth president of the United States recounts his life story.

books.title: Eminent Victorians
books.author: Lytton Strachey
books.summary: Four witty and biting biographies of Victorians that take aim at the moral superiority of their subject’s time.

books.title: Dorothy and the Wizard in Oz
books.author: L. Frank Baum
books.summary: A young girl and her companions travel through dangerous underground realms with the help of an old friend.

books.title: Right Ho, Jeeves
books.author: P. G. Wodehouse
books.summary: Bertie Wooster and his valet Jeeves try their hand at matchmaking in upper-class England.

books.title: The Comedy of Errors
books.author: William Shakespeare
books.summary: Two sets of identical twins are mistaken for their lost siblings.

books.title: The Shaving of Shagpat
books.author: George Meredith
books.summary: A Persian barber embarks on a quest to save a city from the clutches of a tyrant and his magical hair.

books.title: The Little Demon
books.author: Fyodor Sologub
books.summary: A banal and paranoid school teacher falls slowly into madness.

books.title: The House on the Borderland
books.author: William Hope Hodgson
books.summary: An account of the terrifying metaphysical haunting of a recluse’s secluded home.

books.title: The Story of My Experiments with Truth
books.author: Mahatma Gandhi
books.summary: Gandhi relates his life experiences from his birth in Gujarat in 1869 through the Indian National Congress of 1915.

books.title: The Big Four
books.author: Agatha Christie
books.summary: A famous detective must use all his little grey cells to stop an immensely powerful and ruthless organization from taking over the world.

books.title: On the Art of Reading
books.author: Arthur Quiller-Couch
books.summary: Quiller-Couch argues for the study and appreciation of classic English literature.

books.title: Heretics
books.author: G. K. Chesterton
books.summary: A collection of essays in which G. K. Chesterton debates the intellectuals of his day on a range of topics.

books.title: Poetry
books.author: Taras Shevchenko
books.summary: A collection of Taras Shevchenko’s poetry.

books.title: How to Tell the Birds from the Flowers and Other Woodcuts
books.author: Robert Williams Wood
books.summary: A physicist writes and illustrates a collection of humorous poems responding to the Nature Fakers controversy.

books.title: Triplanetary
books.author: E. E. Smith
books.summary: In a universe where all powerful alien races influence the fates of worlds, a war erupts between the Triplanetary League of the inner solar system, pirates led by a mysterious and malicious scientist, and technologically advanced aliens.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Manly Wade Wellman
books.summary: A collection of horror and science fiction stories by Manly Wade Wellman.

books.title: The Kingdom of God Is Within You
books.author: Leo Tolstoy
books.summary: Tolstoy describes true Christianity as a non-hierarchical, nonviolent, non-coercive pursuit, and criticizes institutional Christianity as a deceptive corruption.

books.title: Through the Brazilian Wilderness
books.author: Theodore Roosevelt
books.summary: Theodore Roosevelt’s autobiographical account of his expedition into the uncharted depths of the Brazilian rainforest.
